授業目的: A basic course for standard international economics. Students learn the basics in international trade, business, investment and economic globalization including global value chains. Introductory micro- and macro-economics are not prerequisite, but will make it easier to understand the course. Nevertheless, the purpose of the lecture is not to convey only knowledge, but to motivate students to study further into the field.
到達目標: This course is to nurture the ability to consistently understand issues related to the international economy and grasp policy debates on these issues in a well-balanced way, with historical and geographical considerations in mind.
授業方法: Lecture and seminar online, using ZOOM

第6回: economies of scale and location of production
